## First Practice

Read in this dataset from this URL: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saundersg/Statistics-Notebook/master/Data/Rent.csv 


From this dataset: 

1. select the Apartment, Gender, and Price columns

2. filter the Gender column to female apartments and remove NAs `!is.na(Price)`

3. find the average price of apartments

```{r}
#| eval: false
housing_data <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saundersg/Statistics-Notebook/master/Data/Rent.csv")
head(housing_data)

# Starter Code
housing_data %>% 
    select() %>% 
    filter( , !is.na(Price)) %>% 
    summarise(mean())
```



## Second Practice

The `iris` dataset is built into R. 


1. Create a new column to tell if the Sepal.Length is bigger than or equal to 5

2. Sort the data by Petal.Length

```{r}
#| eval: false
head(iris)

# Starter Code
iris %>%
    mutate() %>% 
    arrange()
```
